forecaster.canada.accounts.registered_account module¶

A Canadian registered account.

These accounts come in various forms, but in general they have a contributor and finite contribution room that grows from year to year.

class forecaster.canada.accounts.registered_account.RegisteredAccount(owner, *args, contribution_room=None, contributor=None, inflation_adjust=None, max_inflow_token=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.accounts.linked_limit.LinkedLimitAccount

An abstract base class for RRSPs, TFSAs, etc.

__init__(owner, *args, contribution_room=None, contributor=None, inflation_adjust=None, max_inflow_token=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Inits RegisteredAccount.

See documentation for Account and LinkedAccount for information on any args not listed below.

Parameters

  • owner (Person) – The person who owns the account. Some types of accounts call this the “annuitant”.

  • contribution_room (Money) –

    The amount of contribution room available in the first year. Optional.

    If not provided, this value will default to None, which makes it easier for subclasses to determine whether it has been set but, if those subclasses don’t take care to set this manually, can lead to hard-to- diagnose errors in client code.

  • contributor (Person) –

    The contributor to the account. Optional.

    If not provided, the contributor is assumed to be the same as the annuitant (i.e. the owner.)

  • inflation_adjust –

    A method with the following form: inflation_adjust(val, this_year, target_year).

    Returns a Decimal object which is the inflation- adjustment factor from base_year to target_year.

    Optional. If not provided, all values are assumed to be in real terms, so no inflation adjustment is performed.

  • max_inflow_token (str) –

    A token that is used to link this account to any other accounts with the same token and contributor. Optional.

    If not provided then by default the max inflows of this account are linked with all other accounts of the same type having the same contributor.

property balance_history¶

Record of balance over all past years.

property contribution_room¶

Returns cached value in *_history dict if available.

property contribution_room_history¶

Record of contribution_room over all past years.

property contributor¶

The Person authorized to contribute to this account.

next_contribution_room()[source]¶

Returns the contribution room for next year.

This method must be implemented by any subclass of RegisteredAccount.

Returns

The contribution room for next year.

Return type

Money

Raises

  • NotImplementedError – Raised if this method is not overridden

  • by a subclass. –

forecaster.canada.accounts.rrsp module¶

Provices Registered Retirement Savings Accounts for Canadians.

class forecaster.canada.accounts.rrsp.RRSP(*args, rrif_conversion_year=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.canada.accounts.registered_account.RegisteredAccount

A Registered Retirement Savings Plan (Canada).

__init__(*args, rrif_conversion_year=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Initializes an RRSP object.

This class also implements RRIFs (which RRSPs are converted into either at a user-defined time or by operation of law). A new object is not created when the RRSP converts to an RRIF; rather, the object’s behaviour changes to limit inflows, require minimum withdrawals, and reduce withholding taxes.

See documentation for RegisteredAccount for information on args not listed below.

Parameters

rrif_conversion_year (int) – The year in which the RRSP object’s behaviour switches from RRSP rules to RRIF rules.

property balance_history¶

Record of balance over all past years.

property contribution_room_history¶

Record of contribution_room over all past years.

convert_to_rrif(year=None)[source]¶

Converts the RRSP to an RRIF.

property min_outflow_limit¶

Minimum annual RRSP/RRIF withdrawal

minimum_distribution()[source]¶

A min. amount required by law to be withdrawn based on age.

next_contribution_room()[source]¶

Determines the amount of contribution room for next year.

Parameters

  • income (Money) – The amount of taxable income for this year used to calculate RRSP contribution room.

  • year (int) – The year in which the income is received.

Returns

The contribution room for the RRSP for the year after year.

property rate_history¶

Record of rate over all past years.

property returns_history¶

Record of returns over all past years.

property rrif_conversion_year¶

The year in which the RRSP is converted to an RRIF.

If not set explicitly, the year in which conversion is required by law is returned (whichever happens first).

Record of tax_credit over all past years.

forecaster.canada.accounts.taxable_account module¶

Provides a Canadian taxable investment account.

class forecaster.canada.accounts.taxable_account.TaxableAccount(owner, balance=0, rate=0, nper=1, inputs=None, initial_year=None, default_timing=None, acb=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: forecaster.accounts.base.Account

A taxable account, non-registered account.

This account uses Canadian rules for determining taxable income from capital assets. That involves tracking the adjusted cost base (acb) of the assets.

See Account for other attributes not listed below.

acb¶

The adjusted cost base of the assets in the account at the start of the year.

Type

Money

capital_gain¶

The total capital gains for the year. This is evaluated lazily, so it may return different values if you add or remove transactions.

Type

Money

__init__(owner, balance=0, rate=0, nper=1, inputs=None, initial_year=None, default_timing=None, acb=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Constructor for TaxableAccount.

See documentation for Account for information on args not listed below.

Parameters

acb (Money) – The adjusted cost base of the assets in the account at the start of initial_year.

property acb

Returns cached value in *_history dict if available.

property acb_history¶

Record of acb over all past years.

add_transaction(value, when='end')[source]¶

Adds a transaction to the account.

Parameters

  • value (Money) – The value of the transaction. Positive values are inflows and negative values are outflows.

  • when (float, Decimal, str) – The timing of the transaction. Must be in the range [0,1] or be a suitable str input, as described in the documentation for when_conv.

Raises

  • decimal.InvalidOperation – Transactions must be convertible to type Money and when must be convertible to type Decimal.

  • ValueError – when must be in [0,1]

Module contents¶

A package for providing Canadian accounts of various kinds.
